stream_context.summary: Kaze spends the session prototyping two new gameplay systems—the rideable "soap bar" and an oil-slick hazard that can be cleaned with the soap—as well as iterating on a memory-efficient redesign of the star-select screen. Much of the time is spent live-coding physics, particle effects, and texture math while debating ROM size, performance and visual clarity.

development_findings.summary: Created a functional rideable "soap bar" by re-using the Koopa-shell action state (ActWritingShell) and the built-in RIDDEN_OBJ interaction pointer, saving significant implementation time.
development_findings.quote: How did I not know that? There's a whole interaction type for this—RIDDEN_OBJ. Alright, I guess we use this.

development_findings.summary: Implemented dynamic scaling on the soap bar so it gradually shrinks and eventually disappears; adjusted Mario's vertical offset and collision so the ride feels natural.
Built a new bubble-trail particle system for the soap bar using a custom engine that avoids texture reloads; bubbles fade from pink to white via N64 combine-modes and IA16 textures.
development_findings.quote: If you don't want to watch me make a bubble texture, you came to the wrong stream. This is progress.

development_findings.summary: Outlined an oil-puddle hazard that will be erased when Mario rides the soap over it; explored alpha-mask erasure, vertex-color hue shifts and optional ice physics, but final visual style still undecided.
development_findings.quote: I think this could work—Mario's just going to be an eraser going through here.

development_findings.summary: Star-select screen is being redesigned: each course will show a tiny 3D panorama instead of large static images to save 0.3–0.5 MB per course and look sharper on emulator.
development_findings.quote: If we have a pre-rendered 3D scene, it's going to be cheaper ROM-wise and it's going to look better on emulator.

development_findings.summary: Memory & performance experiments: deleting original MK64 grass backgrounds freed ~0.3 MB; orange fog was found to hurt frame-rate; discussed DX4 compression and image formats to stay within ROM limits.
Fast64 exporter is the primary level-editing pipeline; Kaze also hints that an unnamed 20-year-old tool author is working on a new version that could be "super cool."
Adopted coding principle: defines are placed near first use and only for constants referenced more than once, reflecting Kaze’s preference for local readability.
development_findings.quote: Any constant that is used more than once is gonna be a define, but I also like to put the define as close as possible to where it's used.

context_findings.summary: Kaze expresses a mix of amusement and frustration with online interactions, noting he received a rape threat—an extreme first—even compared to common death threats.
context_findings.quote: As a male I've gotten a rape threat. That's insane. That's never happened to me before.

context_findings.summary: Shows playful but opinionated philosophy on design (“visual flare is important”) and coding style (hates putting defines globally).
Light personal note: Zeina is at work during the stream; Kaze jokes he is "being held hostage," indicating casual, supportive home dynamic.
Reflects on community toolchains; dislikes frequent Parallel Launcher updates, revealing impatience with maintenance overhead.
context_findings.quote: Every time I open it there's so many updates. It's so annoying.

biobak.summary: Provided concept art for a new star-select screen featuring small panoramas and suggested aesthetic tweaks like parallax and simple sketches.
biobak.quote: Biobak had this here, which I think works a lot better already.

biobak.summary: Requested that soap bubbles fade to white, which Kaze implemented via combine-modes.
biobak.quote: Biobak’s wish was to have this fade to white come true.

zeina.summary: No development work this session; only mentioned as being at her day job.

key_stories.title: The Birth of the Soap Bar
key_stories.summary: Kaze wants a new mobility gimmick: a surfboard-like bar of soap. Reusing the Koopa shell state, he debugs collision, shrinking logic, and builds a bespoke bubble trail.
key_stories.challenge: Create a rideable object that feels unique but leverages existing SM64 mechanics.
key_stories.process: Discovered RIDDEN_OBJ pointer, copied ActWritingShell, tuned scaling variables, built particle system, and iterated on camera sync.
key_stories.outcome: Soap bar now fully rideable, auto-despawns, and leaves stylized bubbles.
key_stories.key_quote: We programmed the whole soap bar just today—that's not that bad.

key_stories.title: Star-Select Space Budget
key_stories.summary: The team wants richer course previews but must fit within strict ROM limits. Static images are big; Biobak’s sketches inspire a 3D-panorama compromise.
key_stories.challenge: Display evocative course art without burning 0.5 MB per level.
key_stories.process: Benchmarked texture sizes, removed MK64 grass to gauge savings, tested anti-aliased textures, discussed DX4 compression, decided on miniature 3D scenes and parallax.
key_stories.outcome: Direction set to 3D panoramas rendered in-engine; UI mock-ups still evolving.
key_stories.key_quote: A 320×240 still would take 0.5 MB—that’s a lot of space.

key_stories.title: Oil Slick Dilemma
key_stories.summary: To complement the soap, Kaze prototypes an oil puddle that can be cleaned. He experiments with alpha-mask erasure, hue-shift reflections, and considers ice physics.
key_stories.challenge: Make oil look convincing, interactive, and performant on N64 hardware.
key_stories.process: Searched reference images, debated rainbow vs. black look, built dynamic texture tests, and took notes for future implementation.
key_stories.outcome: Mechanic concept solid; visual style unresolved and queued for next stream.
key_stories.key_quote: I wish I had oil here I could spill on the floor and look at.
